info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 12:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EDT... At 1246 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Brecon, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Lebanon, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Madeira, Deer Park, Blanchester, South Middletown, West Chester and Morrow. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 10 and 37. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 12 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
